reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a rule that I usually follow, but one I ignored (and now regret) this time: Don't stay at the cheapest place! Of the casino hotels, the Isle offered me a rate of $109. I wish I had stayed at the Grand for $20 more. It's not that the Isle of Capri is bad, but it's not all that great either. Rooms are very clean but rather austere. The hotel itself was too quiet for a Friday night. The room, on the other hand, was far too noisy for a Saturday morning.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
Dead Atmosphere
reviews.text: BEDS/ROOM: Hotels across the country are upgrading their beds, to improve their guests' sleep. The Isle hasn't joined this trend, and it was not a very comfortable night compared to what you might find at say... Courtyard by Marriott. The shower was good, though, and the TV had a nice selection. I believe you'll get a view of the water from any room. We also had a birds' eye view of the construction next door, but that's temporary.

ATMOSPHERE: It's pretty quiet. At 11PM on a Friday night, you'd think the place would be hopping. Nope! The casino wasn't all that busy, and beyond the gaming, it was completely dead. By 12Midnight, the Isle gave out an "it's time to go to bed" vibe.
reviews.title: Surprised at the quality for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NOISE: There is plenty of construction going on next door, and they started at 7AM on Saturday morning! The EAST side of the building may be quieter, but I believe some work may be happening on that side too (either now or soon). Meanwhile, I don't know if the walls were too thin or if the woman next door was yelling really loud. Probably the latter. She started at 6:30AM and was yelling at her kids nonstop by 9AM... the construction noise only added to the ambiance.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant!

reviews.text: AMENITIES: The Isle has a Starbucks, a spa, a pool and a pool bar. It has a gift shop too. But I was surprised to see very little open after 11PM. For a place that's billed as a "resort," that's very surprising. If you need some ibuprofen or Rolaids late at night, for example, you're still driving to Walgreen's. That seems silly for a 700-room hotel with so many people on duty.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: I had a great time here. I was just looking for a comfortable place to stay, not into gambling at all .... so the casino nor the buffet are important for me. What I cared, the room, was really nice. Very clean, excellent spacious bathroom, great decor, ocean view, very quiet. I didn't pay the full-rate, so I was more than happy!
reviews.title: Great Hotwire deal !

reviews.text: Wow...might be the worst hotel on the coast!! Bad room, bad food, bad casino! All for an overpriced room. I won't be back. Too many great choices for less money.
reviews.title: horrible
Nearly starved
reviews.text: We were there for three nights. The room was very clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. The buffet food was awful, we tried it once but didn't return. We used our food comps at the Marketplace(Food Court) and survived on sandwiches and soup which wase excellent

We rented two rooms for our stay, one at the standard rate for $69 and the second at $20 more so we could have a balcony. We made an interesting dicovery. The cheaper room which is in a newer section of the hotel was a much nicer room. The bathroom was 3 to 4 star in quality as was the rest of the room. The balcony room was two star quality and was not totally renovated since Katrina particularly the bathroom but also lighting fixture, etc. The balcony was east facing with the nice morning sun but it also was above the cooling systems for the hotel and quite noisy. (Ask for a west facing balcony which over looks the construction for three new casinos but it will be less noisy).
reviews.title: Two or Three Stars Depending

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even the newer room had noise problems. You easily hear conversations in the rooms on either side and others through the bathroom vents and pipes.
reviews.title: Don't expect more than 3 star quality

reviews.text: It is a casino hotel that might be a 3 star, no more than that. Pretty funny in my book that a huge casino hotel doesn't at least have HBO or MTV on the TV in the rooms - cheap! The room was comfortable and roomy. Obvious though that the intent is to get you into the casino which is why most people are there. If you can get a good rate here than go for it but I wouldn't pay triple digits to stay here. Breakfast buffet was below average and the service was also below average at the buffet.
reviews.title: Average Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a jacuzzi room for a Friday and Saturday night at an average of $159/night. The entire property appeared very clean and we were impressed with our room. I have no doubt that we will stay there again. The buffet needed more variety. I didn't really find great payoffs on the slot machines, but we aren't big gamblers.
reviews.title: Will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here overnight on a trip to New Orleans. The isle of Capri was great for the rate we got on Hotwire. I saved about $100 compared to what I would have had somewhere else. Room and bathroom were large. They have valet service which might be useful as the parking structures are a long walk. For a saturday night stay, they had a nice band downstairs near the non-smoking section of the casino. Casino payouts weren't very good. Right on the main drag. Didn't eat anywhere here so I can't comment on that. Would do it again.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

likes.disliked: — Slow reception desk that ignored me for 5 minutes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was standard and clean. Balcony room had a great view. Worth the money, but the food is expensive and not very good. Casino was rather small and the comps and point system does nothing for a weekender. Biloxi is a nice weekend getaway but unless you want to go on the cheap, stay at one of the other casinos.
reviews.title: Just OK
Training Needed at the Isle
reviews.text: Only reason I'm not rating the casino/hotel as "terrible" is the junior suite was clean, nice and comfortable and got a great rate. Saw a 24 hour internet special for a $19.99 room rate (including junior suites). It was for a Saturday night. So excellent rate.

reviews.title: Not a great place to stay in Biloxi
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Isle of Capri Casino for two nights in July of '07. We live in Louisiana and wanted to take the kids to the beach yet, not have to drive very far to get there. We usually vacation in Florida but, due to the high gas prices we opted for Mississippi instead. After researching all of the hotels in the area, including Casino hotels, we chose the Isle of Capri. The price was better than most ($89 a night) and it seemed like a nice place from the pictures on the website. The first thing I noticed was that it was at the end of the strip, literally. The Biloxi bridge is just after it and is out, apparently due to Hurricane Katrina. The Isle is situated in the middle of a marina, which means you do not have access to the beach from the hotel. We had to drive down the road to go to the beach. That was one of the major problems. The other was that you have to travel through the casino to get to your hotel room, very inconvenient when traveling with children and several bags. You have to park in a parking garage, walk down a covered walkway into the building and through the casino, up an escalator(or stairs if you're carrying luggage) to the elevator on the other end. The room itself was a nice size, although the decor looked cheap. The theme is tropical but the colors are too loud. We had 2 queen beds in our room and there was plenty of space to move around. The bathroom was also roomy. The room was clean and well stocked with towels and toletries. There's no childcare available at any of the casinos so don't bring kids if you plan to gamble, unless you have someone to watch them. My sister came with us and helped out. Overall, it was O.K. but, I'll try somewhere else next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Started off by makeing reservation two days before Memorial day weekend, and called hotel for availibilty to my suprise they had rooms availible, the price was steep then I said I need casino rate and price was adjusted. They told me to see casino host at check out for room comps. After my wife and I dropped our things in room we went to get our players card and look at casinos, first floor is all non smoking and second floor is smoking. My wife inserts her players card and after second play on video poker machine bells and whistles go off and attendent promply informs her she just won $100.00 for useing players card and attendent informs us which video poker machine have best odds to play. Room had wonderful veiw of Gulf, And was as nice as any room in Vegas as a matter of fact room was twice as big as Treasure Island and MGM. food at buffet was better than any buffet Ive eaten at in Biloxi, just not much to look at. After A wonderful stay we went to check out and our room was free for all three nights also all meals at buffet where comped, I would come back for sure.
reviews.title: The Real Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was truly the worst hotel experience ever. We booked the room late, and knew the rate would be high. When we were told $279.00 we were shocked but figured it would be worth it. Boy were we wrong. We met up with friends who booked the day before and got the room for 100.00 cheaper.
reviews.title: Never again
Hmmmm just ok
reviews.text: The room is ok. Looks like any other cheap hotel room. The floors in this hotel are filthy all over. The pillows are pathetic. There were holes in the comforter. You would think they could buy a new one. Took a shower. NO HOT WATER. Woke up the next morning. We had a coffee pot, and cups, but no coffee. I guess that is their way of making us go downstairs and buy a 3.00 cup of coffee.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we went to check out the attendant was rude. Said "Well these things happen" When we told about the no hot water, and no coffee. In the end we got a whopping 50 dollar credit. Yeah we will never be back.
reviews.title: One Night Was Enough

likes.disliked: — Attitude and lack of professionalism of employees.
